snippet: Most economists and investors view the debt ceiling as a much more significant issue for the economy which has the potential to set off a global financial crisis.
abstract: Impasse in Congress over government shutdown has overshadowed fact that government is approaching its debt ceiling on Oct 17; most economists and investors view debt ceiling as much more significant issue for the economy, with potential to set off a global financial crisis; basic questions are answered.
lead_paragraph: Most economists and investors view the debt ceiling as a much more significant issue for the economy which has the potential to set off a global financial crisis.

headline.main: How a Debt Ceiling Crisis Could Do More Harm Than the Shutdown
headline.print_headline: How a Debt Ceiling Crisis Could Do More Harm Than the Shutdown

keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
keywords.name: subject
